metadata.title: CVE-2022-28285 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description: When generating the assembly code forMLoadTypedArrayElementHole, an incorrect AliasSet was used. Inconjunction with another vulnerability this could have been used for an outof bounds memory read. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 91.8,Firefox < 99, and Firefox ESR < 91.8. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-28285` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 1:1snap1-0ubuntu1 No subscription required thunderbird - 1:91.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1 No subscription required libmozjs-91-0 - 91.10.0-0ubuntu1 No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1snap1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:91.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs91 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '91.10.0-0ubuntu1').
